name: Write in Secrecy 2
description: The sequel to my style which hides text when composing mail (and to a degree presently, instant messaging) so nobody sees what you're typing.
additional_info: Update 1: I forgot to fix the settings for GMail! Whoops, resolved now. Update 2: Hotmail is now in Write in Secrecy; Outlook takes Hotmail's place. If you are using basic webmail, or older clients, then you'll want Write in Secrecy, remade from the ground-up. This version of Write in Secrecy is for the revamped webmail clients for Google GMail, Yahoo! Mail, America Online Mail and Microsoft Live Mail (Outlook). Whiie mildly frustrating to create, I managed to make it work completely across all webmail clients, and with opacity in CSS standard, those using other browsers can slightly re-work the code to work outside of Firefox, provided other browsers conform to CSS 3 world standards. I made sure this style hides everything. Only until you hover over an item, is it invisible, so you can click in a field an see what you are typing, then move the mouse away from the field to make text disappear. Tips to ensure this style works to the best of its ability: * Make text/hidden objects visible when nobody is looking * Send plain text only -- No attachments or downloads that will alter the screen * QUICKLY correct spelling errors. * Occasionally do something else, and disable the mouse when away. I am bound to encounter other bugs and glitches, so feel free to leave comments suggesting improvements! While you can, PLEASE do not use this style for acts of evil and harm.
